intro: Antiphylla squarrosula, commonly known as the rough antiphylla, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and produces small, star-shaped flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its water-storing tissues. Antiphylla squarrosula is often found in rocky or sandy soils, showcasing its resilience to drought and extreme temperatures.
